abstract: Relations between police officers and poor, black communities remain tense in South Africa decades after apartheid; many residents still struggle to trust officers, despite fact that police force has become institution controlled by black majority as well; example of township of Alexandra, South Africa, profiled.
lead_paragraph: Forces now mirror a largely black population, but are seen by many as not focused on keeping it safe as killings of and by officers occur at higher rates than in the United States.
